required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Utilizing Holmium Laser for FURS Renal Stone Lithotripsy Comparing Stone Breaking vs. Stone Dusting Settings
clinical_study.official_title: Utilizing Holmium Laser for FURS Renal Stone Lithotripsy Comparing Stone Breaking vs. Stone Dusting Settings

brief_summary.textblock: Twenty (20) subjects presenting with a renal stone and candidates for FURS (flexible ureteroscopic renal surgery) will undergo a single FURS procedure for a kidney stone as part of the study, using the study device. These subjects will be randomized into stone breaking treatment or stone dusting.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Stone clearance based on 1 month follow-up imaging data as compared to baseline
primary_outcome.description: stone clearance will be confirmed by CT or X-Ray at 1 month follow up.
Duration of catheterization will be measured to evaluate treatment efficiency
duration of the procedure as an indicator for treatment efficiency.

primary_outcome.measure: Usage of alternative stone extracting devices
primary_outcome.description: The need of the surgeon to use baskets, forceps or saline flushing to achieve complete stone clearance. This outcome can influence both procedure time and further complication.
hospital duration will be measured to evaluate treatment efficiency

secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the procedure and during 1 month follow up
secondary_outcome.description: Intraoperative Complications will be evaluated based on Modified Clavien Classification- Modified Clavien Grading: Grade 1,Grade 2,Grade 3,Grade 3a,Grade 3b,Grade 4,Grade 4a, Grade 4b, Grade 5.
clear vision of the stone and organ compartments as reflected via endoscope and video screen.

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of retropulsion that interferes with procedure
secondary_outcome.description: The subjective degree of stone movement and migration as a result of the laser treatment that interfere with procedure flow.
The surgeon will evaluate the degree of Fiber flexibility with scope deflection- and any damage to fiber, Fiber durability- deflection without losing energy/ efficiency and any Damage to scope.

arm_group.description: Lithotripsy will be performed using the Lumenis Pulse 120H holmium laser system with low frequency parameters.
Lithotripsy will be performed using the Lumenis Pulse 120H holmium laser system with high frequency parameters.

intervention.intervention_name: Lumenis Pulse 120H holmium laser system and 200 DFL ball tip fiber
intervention.description: The Lumenis Pulse P120H will be utilized in high and low frequencies according to subjects group allocation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Subject will be older than 18 years of age
2. Subject was diagnosed with renal calculi meeting the following criteria:
- Largest stone measures no more than 2cm on a single diameter and is no less than 0.8cm as defined by X-ray or CT.
- Accumulative stone burden (addition of all stone diameters) is no more than 2.5cm.
3. Subject is a candidate for FURS procedure
4. Subject is willing and has signed the Informed Consent Form
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Subject has undergone a previous treatment for stones in the same kidney
2. Subject requires another, concomitant procedure, other than FURS, to be performed during this treatment session.
3. Female subject is pregnant
4. Concomitant anticoagulant medication that cannot be suspended during surgery
